objects.name: Polygon
text: As we all know, polygon is a plane figure that is bounded by a finite chain of 2D line segments. Here, link_to(documentation/Polygon) is an object made of closed form of link_to(documentation/PolygonPoint)'s.
Each polygon can be repositioned by mouse dragging. Moreover, it is also possible to move each PolygonPoint.
Polygon can be initialized by several ways. You can see details on link_to(documentation/createPolygon) function documentation page.
Mouse drag event can be triggered, when it is used this way:
// event triggering to polygon, when it is dragged
for (var i in polygon.points) // access each polygon point

objects.name: PolygonPoint
text: PolygonPoint is an object which represents 2D point in the plane. It is visually shown as black point and id.
Mouse drag event can be triggered, when it is used this way:
polygon.points.p0.mouseDragEvent = function(){ // event triggering to polygon point

functions.name: clear
text: This function clears log screen which located upper-right part of the coding screen. It is on the link_to(playground) page. This code below first clear the screen, then traverses and prints the polygon points.
for (var i in polygon.points) // access each polygon point

functions.name: draw
text: This function is used to draw objects on the screen.

functions.name: createPolygon
text: Polygon can be created by several ways. This function takes predefined strings to run properly. Otherwise it returns an error. Here you will see some examples:
Note: In createPolygon, 'star', 'square', 'triangle_set' are predefined strings. It does not support polygon types other than those.
It is also possible to determine the location and size of a polygon while creating it.
